Product Description: ['Time Machine, The (DVD) (Rpkg)', "In this adaptation of H.G. Wells' classic novel, a scientist in 1880s Victorian England builds a vehicle to transport him through time. He first travels to 1917 and the horror of World War I. Next, he sets his destination for 1940 and the start of World War II. From there he travels to a future London when he barely escapes nuclear holocaust. Finally, he sets his destination for the year 802,701 C.E., when he meets an innocent race of people living in an idyllic land ... but this future may be the most dangerous of all his journeys in The Time Machine.", ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.8

great movie
Derailed (Unrated Widescreen)
Jennifer Aniston  (Actor),     Vincent Cassel  (Actor),     Mikael Hafstrom  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
["Advertising executive Charles Schine is just another Chicago commuter who regularly catches the 8:43 A.M. train to work. But the one day he misses his train and meets Lucinda Harris, his life is changed forever. Lucinda is charming, beautiful and seductive. Despite the fact that each are married with children, their attraction to one another is magnetic. Lunch dates quickly become cocktails after work, and before long, Charles and Lucinda's infatuation leads them to a hotel room. Their seemingly perfect affair goes terribly awry when LaRoche, a brutal stranger, breaks into their room and holds them at gunpoint. This once illicit liaison turns into a nightmare more dangerous and violent than either could have ever imagined. Charles' life soon becomes filled with deception, blackmail, violence and crime. Unable to confide in his wife or speak to the police, Charles finds himself trapped in a world he doesn't recognize, with no trace of the life he once knew."]

The Professional
Jean Reno  (Actor),     Gary Oldman  (Actor),     Luc Besson  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman and Danny Aiello star in', 'Leon the Professional', ', a go-for-broke thriller about a professional assassin whose work becomes dangerously personal. Calling himself a "cleaner," the mysterious Léon is New York\'s top hit man. When his next-door neighbors are murdered, Léon becomes the unwilling guardian of the family\'s sole survivor - 12-year-old Mathilda. But Mathilda doesn\'t just want protection; she wants revenge. Training her in the deadly tricks of his trade, Léon helps her track the psychotic agent who murdered her family. From the electrifying opening to the fatal finale,', 'Leon the Professional', ', is a nonstop crescendo of action, suspense and surprises. Experience the uncut version, with 24 minutes of footage not included in the original U.S. theatrical version.']

GREAT MOVIE....... Having the actual DVD I can watch it antie anywhere even in the car.....
GREAT MOVIE
Scandal At Scourie (1953)
Greer Garson  (Actor),     Walter Pidgeon  (Actor),     Jean Negulesco  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
["Legendary Hollywood screen pair Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon team for the ninth and last time in Scandal at Scourie, a heart-tugging Technicolor drama that has the duo facing obstacles with the kind of unbreakable love that saw them through aerial bombardments in Mrs. Miniver or the challenges of the medical unknown in Madame Curie. Set in Ontario, Canada, the story centers on Victoria and Patrick McChesney, whose decision to adopt an orphaned Catholic girl ignites controversy in their Protestant community. Patrick is accused of using the adoption to appeal to Catholic voeters and advance his political career. Victoria contends with self-righteous whispers about the child's out-of-wedlock birth. And an event in the child's past leads to a fear-mongering change that she is a pyromaniac. Passions and accusations rage. But like a ship plying stormy seas, the McChesney' love for each other and their child will prevail."]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Movie Genre Preference:** The user continues to enjoy engaging narratives, with an expanding appreciation for classic films, including science fiction and vintage dramas. Their interest in complex emotional dynamics is evident across various styles, emphasizing a well-rounded taste in cinema.
- **Format Preference:** They remain loyal to the DVD format, highlighting a nostalgic connection to physical media and its practicality for convenient viewing.
- **Positive Rating Tendencies:** The user consistently awards high ratings, as shown by their latest 5-star review, reflecting a discerning taste that resonates deeply with skillfully crafted films.
- **Content Engagement:** Beyond contemporary thrillers and classic dramas, the user also appreciates classic science fiction narratives that offer rich storytelling and emotional depth, reinforcing their love for multifaceted cinema.
- **Actors and Directors:** Their enthusiasm for established actors and directors persists, particularly those recognized for powerful performances and compelling stories, showcasing a preference for familiar talent that enhances their viewing experience.
- **Ease of Purchase:** The user values efficient online purchasing experiences, continuing to seek quality selections through convenient platforms to fulfill their refined taste in films.

Overall, the user remains dedicated to skillfully crafted films with rich narratives, cherishing the DVD format, and exploring both classic and modern cinematic stories that engage their intellect and emotions.
